<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 194, 220, 209]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 216, 356, 233]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Pure Mathematics 1 (P1)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 259, 460, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 320, 390, 338]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 351, 828, 367]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 367, 722, 383]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 384, 327, 400]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 400, 497, 416]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 416, 601, 433]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 447, 284, 463]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 463, 908, 495]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 494, 590, 510]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 510, 606, 526]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 540, 606, 556]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 556, 756, 572]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 572, 440, 588]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 588, 908, 619]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 73, 161, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[166, 73, 757, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the first 3 terms in the expansion of \((2 - y)^5\) in ascending powers of \(y\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 918, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 107, 154, 125]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 106, 856, 125]]<|/det|>
Use the result in part (i) to find the coefficient of \(x^{2}\) in the expansion of \(\left(2 - (2x - x^{2})\right)^{5}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 107, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 154, 97, 173]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 153, 485, 173]]<|/det|>
The functions f and g are defined for \(x \in \mathbb{R}\) by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 179, 561, 198]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{f}:x\mapsto 3x + a,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 201, 561, 220]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{g}:x\mapsto b - 2x,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 228, 685, 247]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants. Given that \(\mathrm{ff}(2) = 10\) and \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}(2) = 3\), find

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[124, 254, 153, 272]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 254, 331, 272]]<|/det|>
the values of \(a\) and \(b\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 254, 920, 272]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 279, 151, 297]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 279, 348, 297]]<|/det|>
an expression for \(\mathrm{fg}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 279, 920, 297]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 324, 97, 343]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 324, 715, 344]]<|/det|>
Relative to an origin \(O\), the position vectors of points \(A\) and \(B\) are given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[323, 350, 675, 373]]<|/det|>
\[\overrightarrow{OA} = 5\mathbf{i} + \mathbf{j} + 2\mathbf{k}\quad \mathrm{and}\quad \overrightarrow{OB} = 2\mathbf{i} + 7\mathbf{j} + p\mathbf{k},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 381, 294, 400]]<|/det|>
where \(p\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 411, 151, 430]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 411, 542, 431]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(p\) for which angle \(AOB\) is \(90^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 412, 920, 431]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 443, 153, 462]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 443, 920, 481]]<|/det|>
In the case where \(p = 4\), find the vector which has magnitude 28 and is in the same direction as \(\overrightarrow{AB}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 463, 920, 481]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 508, 96, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 508, 920, 528]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(y^{2} + 2x = 13\) and the equation of a line is \(2y + x = k\), where \(k\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 540, 153, 559]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 540, 920, 559]]<|/det|>
In the case where \(k = 8\), find the coordinates of the points of intersection of the line and the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 556, 920, 574]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 585, 153, 604]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 585, 655, 604]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(k\) for which the line is a tangent to the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 586, 920, 604]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 631, 96, 650]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 631, 838, 650]]<|/det|>
(i) Sketch, on the same diagram, the graphs of \(y = \sin x\) and \(y = \cos 2x\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 180^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 664, 153, 682]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 663, 920, 698]]<|/det|>
Verify that \(x = 30^{\circ}\) is a root of the equation \(\sin x = \cos 2x\), and state the other root of this equation for which \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 180^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 682, 920, 700]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 710, 148, 728]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 710, 769, 728]]<|/det|>
Hence state the set of values of \(x\), for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 180^{\circ}\), for which \(\sin x < \cos 2x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 710, 920, 728]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 84, 829, 361]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 375, 920, 432]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a circle \(C_{1}\) touching a circle \(C_{2}\) at a point \(X\). Circle \(C_{1}\) has centre \(A\) and radius \(6\mathrm{cm}\), and circle \(C_{2}\) has centre \(B\) and radius \(10\mathrm{cm}\). Points \(D\) and \(E\) lie on \(C_{1}\) and \(C_{2}\) respectively and \(DE\) is parallel to \(AB\). Angle \(DAX = \frac{1}{3}\pi\) radians and angle \(EBX = \theta\) radians.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 444, 151, 463]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 444, 920, 492]]<|/det|>
By considering the perpendicular distances of \(D\) and \(E\) from \(AB\), show that the exact value of \(\theta\) is \(\sin^{-1}\left(\frac{3\sqrt{3}}{10}\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[88, 504, 121, 522]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 504, 727, 522]]<|/det|>
Find the perimeter of the shaded region, correct to 4 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 504, 920, 522]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 555, 92, 574]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 551, 920, 597]]<|/det|>
A curve is such that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = 5 - \frac{8}{x^2}\). The line \(3y + x = 17\) is the normal to the curve at the point \(P\) on the curve. Given that the \(x\)-coordinate of \(P\) is positive, find

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 604, 151, 623]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 604, 326, 623]]<|/det|>
the coordinates of \(P\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 604, 920, 623]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 630, 151, 648]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 630, 364, 648]]<|/det|>
the equation of the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 630, 920, 648]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 675, 96, 694]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 675, 497, 694]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(y = \sqrt{(8x - x^2)}\). Find

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 704, 153, 723]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 704, 779, 728]]<|/det|>
an expression for \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\), and the coordinates of the stationary point on the curve,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 705, 920, 724]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 736, 153, 754]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 736, 920, 769]]<|/det|>
the volume obtained when the region bounded by the curve and the \(x\)-axis is rotated through \(360^{\circ}\) about the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 752, 920, 771]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[287, 838, 710, 856]]<|/det|>
[Questions 9 and 10 are printed on the next page.]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[272, 81, 761, 348]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 367, 920, 416]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a quadrilateral \(ABCD\) in which the point \(A\) is \((- 1, - 1)\), the point \(B\) is \((3, 6)\) and the point \(C\) is \((9, 4)\). The diagonals \(AC\) and \(BD\) intersect at \(M\). Angle \(BMA = 90^\circ\) and \(BM = MD\). Calculate

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 424, 153, 442]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 424, 386, 442]]<|/det|>
the coordinates of \(M\) and \(D\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 424, 920, 442]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 448, 139, 467]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 448, 316, 467]]<|/det|>
the ratio \(AM:MC\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 448, 920, 467]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 495, 106, 514]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 495, 146, 514]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 495, 920, 529]]<|/det|>
An arithmetic progression contains 25 terms and the first term is \(- 15\). The sum of all the terms in the progression is 525. Calculate

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[165, 535, 188, 554]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 535, 537, 554]]<|/det|>
the common difference of the progression,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 535, 920, 554]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 560, 190, 579]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 560, 450, 579]]<|/det|>
the last term in the progression,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 560, 920, 579]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 585, 190, 603]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 585, 608, 603]]<|/det|>
the sum of all the positive terms in the progression.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 585, 920, 603]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 616, 146, 634]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 616, 920, 650]]<|/det|>
A college agrees a sponsorship deal in which grants will be received each year for sports equipment. This grant will be \(\)4000\(in 2012 and will increase by\) 5\%\$ each year. Calculate

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[165, 657, 190, 675]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 657, 440, 675]]<|/det|>
the value of the grant in 2022,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 657, 920, 675]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 681, 203, 700]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[208, 681, 806, 700]]<|/det|>
the total amount the college will receive in the years 2012 to 2022 inclusive.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 681, 920, 700]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]
